intro: Heteropleura crepidisperma, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that develop into fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along roadsides. Due to its hardy nature, it is considered a resilient weed in some regions.
